item.description: The Association of Portsmouth Taxpayers is having a special meeting to discuss a proposed spending cap and tax cap. Bill St. Laurent, the chair, says, “If you are interested in doing this we need as many people, not just APT members, as possible to attend … Although the City Council is shooting for a zero budget for the next fiscal year, and this is good, we need to look to the future budgets and let them know we are not going to sit back and let them keep digging into taxpayers’ pockets to pay for their desires.”
item.name: Portsmouth tax cap planning
